Deficiency Narrative: One child in care service plan was not completed within the 45 day timeframe.
Correction Narrative: The inspector received an email from the operation's administrator. According to the email, the case manager and treatment director have received training during the timeframe when the service plan and preliminary plans are due.

Deficiency Narrative:
Children in care have specific supervision needs for one-on-one supervision during waking hours, both within the facility and outside.  The operation has failed to staff the facility appropriately, ensuring that staff can meet each child's supervision needs.  Additionally, on multiple occasions, a group of children, including one child with 1:1 supervision needs, were left unsupervised at a local park. 

During a follow-up inspection, two children in care were supervised 1:1, and one child was observed to be unsupervised.
Correction Narrative: The inspector received an email from the operation's administrator. The administrator stated that all caregivers and admins have received training on supervision and the importance of ensuring the safety of children in care at all times.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care eloped from the operation while staff were asleep and returned with stolen weapons
Correction Narrative: This standard is being found compliant.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation failed to complete a suicide risk screening or assessment by a mental health professional after a child exhibited self-harming behaviors.
Correction Narrative: The operation failed to complete a suicide risk screening or assessment by a mental health professional after a child exhibited self-harming behaviors.

Deficiency Narrative: Two children in care preliminary service plans were not completed within-in 72 hours.
Correction Narrative: Two children in care preliminary service plans were not completed within-in 72 hours.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care have specific supervision needs for one-on-one supervision during waking hours, both within the facility and outside.  The operation has failed to staff the facility appropriately, ensuring that staff can meet each child's supervision needs.  Additionally, on multiple occasions, a group of children, including one child with 1:1 supervision needs, were left unsupervised at a local park.
The operation staff have failed to maintain the ratio due to one staff member being assigned to a group of three children, including two children who require 1:1 supervision.
Correction Narrative: The operation staff have failed to maintain the ratio due to one staff member being assigned to a group of three children, including two children who require 1:1 supervision.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff member was missing sucide prevention training.
Correction Narrative: On April 18, 2025, the inspector received an updated suicide prevention training certificate from the operations administrator. The inspector reminded the administrator that the training is required annually.
